name: alisma subcordatum
description: Mud Plantain is also called American Water Plaintain and Alisma plantago-aquatica.  It sends up a flowering stem from their clumped base leaves. The small flowers have white or pink-tinged petals. Ribbon-like leaves formed underwater rarely are seen on adult plants because they tend to rot.  A typical emergent aquatic plant, Mud Plantain's lower part is often below water while its upper part is exposed.
features: Deer Resistant (Our experiences here in the Upper Midwest may vary in other regions; deer can respond differently to local conditions or seasonal variations.)
